t: Proverbs 3
Trust the Lord
My*pn son, don’t forget my teaching, but*ln let your heart keep my commands;
for*ln they will bring you many*ln days, a full life, and well-being.
Never*ln let loyalty and faithfulness leave you. Tie*ln them around your neck; write*ln them on the tablet of your heart.
Then*ln you will find favor and high regard with*ln God and people.
Trust*pn in the Lord*s with all your heart, and*ln do not rely on your own understanding;
in*ln all your ways know him, and*ln he will make your paths straight.
Don’t*ln be wise in your own eyes; fear*ln the Lord*s and turn away from evil.
This*ln will be healing for your body and*ln strengthening for your bones.
Honor*ln the Lord*s with your possessions and*ln with the first produce of your entire harvest;
then*ln your barns will be completely filled, and*ln your vats will overflow with new wine.
Do*ln not despise the Lord’s*s instruction, my son, and*ln do not loathe his discipline;
for*ln the Lord*s disciplines the one he loves, just*ln as a father disciplines the son in whom he delights.
Wisdom Brings Happiness
Happy*pn is a man who finds wisdom and*ln who acquires understanding,
for*ln she is more profitable than silver, and*ln her revenue is better than gold.
She*ln is more precious than jewels; nothing*ln you desire can equal her.
Long*ln life is in her right hand; in*ln her left, riches and honor.
Her*ln ways are pleasant, and*ln all her paths, peaceful.
She*ln is a tree of life to those who embrace her, and*ln those who hold on to her are happy.
The*pn Lord*s founded the earth by wisdom and*ln established the heavens by understanding.
By*ln his knowledge the watery depths broke open, and*ln the clouds dripped with dew.
Maintain*pn sound wisdom and discretion. My*ln son, don’t lose sight of them.
They*ln will be life for you and*ln adornment for your neck.
Then*ln you will go safely on your way; your*ln foot will not stumble.
When*ln you lie down, you will not be afraid; you*ln will lie down, and your sleep will be pleasant.
Don’t*ln fear sudden danger or*ln the ruin of the wicked when it comes,
for*ln the Lord*s will be your confidence and*ln will keep your foot from a snare.
Treat Others Fairly
When*pn it is in your power, don’t*ln withhold good from the one to whom it belongs.
Don’t*ln say to your neighbor, “Go away! Come back later. I’ll*ln give it tomorrow” — when it is there with you.
Don’t*ln plan any harm against your neighbor, for*ln he trusts you and lives near you.
Don’t*ln accuse anyone without cause, when*ln he has done you no harm.
Don’t*ln envy a violent man or*ln choose any of his ways;
for*ln the devious are detestable to the Lord,*s but*ln he is a friend to the upright.
The*ln Lord’s*s curse is on the household of the wicked, but*ln he blesses the home of the righteous;
He*ln mocks those who mock but*ln gives grace to the humble.
The*ln wise will inherit honor, but*ln he holds up fools to dishonor.
